subject: Re: (No results back from JUnit?) Success in firewall-free environment.
msgSnippet: ... which ... of ... sure ... firewall ... nor ... might ... By ... one ... seeing. ... Hi.. As you suggested, I tried runnig the test by disabling the
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...>
wrote:
> amit wrote:
> > I have tried the sample test, called "JWebUnitSearchExample"
which
> > performs a Google search for Httpunit and validates the presence
of
> > link, given in the documentation of jwebunit.
> > I run it through command prompt with command
> > "java junit.textui.TestRunner
> > net.sourceforge.jwebunit.sample.JWebUnitSearchExample", I am not
sure
> > whether it runs successfuly as I dont get any messages and my
firewall
> > alerts me about the application accessing the net. After while the
> > application returns to command prompt again, displayin no results
nor
> > any errors.
>




> Can you execute the same test in a firewall-free environment? That
might
> tell you where the problem is.
>
> Still, I've never heard of a test runner /not/ reporting results.
By
> chance, is any of the code anywhere redirecting System.out and
> System.err? Is the a logfile somewhere you can look through? That's
one
> thing I can imagine that would account for the behavior you're
seeing.
> --

Hi..

As you suggested, I tried runnig the test by disabling the
firewall. It worked in both text and graphical mode of junit. I got
results with no errors and failures.
Enabling the firewall caused same error and everythig was normal
by disabling it. I could not get what the problem was.

Anyways, Thanks a lot for your help.

Regards,
Amit
